subject: p13450581
History: Patient with left upper lobe mass. Transbronchial biopsy. Rule out pneumothorax.
Findings: New alveolar consolidation is seen around left upper lobe cavitary lesion compatible with important bleeding after biopsy. Right lung is unremarkable. There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Mediastinal and cardiac contour are within normal limits.
Impression: New consolidation is seen around left upper lobe cavitary lesion compatible with important hemorrhage post-biopsy. Dr. Was contacted at 1:30 pm. With the results. Time of the exam : 11:49 am.
